source.name: Question 5
source.instructions:
The following text is found in the file `/etc/profile`.
```bash
for i in /etc/profile.d/*.sh ; do
  if [ -r "$i" ]; then
    . $i
  fi
done
```
Which of the following best describes the execution of this text?

answers.answer: For every file in the /etc/profile.d directory that ends .sh, if it is readable, source it.
For every file in the /etc/profile.d directory that ends .sh, if it is readable, execute it.
For every file in the /etc/profile.d directory that ends .sh, if it is executable, execute it.
For every file in the /etc/profile.d directory that ends .sh, if it is not a directory, source it.
